author: Staff Reporter
text:
More than 7,000 electronic voting machines and 4,000 ballot control units arrived in the city on Wednesday, ahead of the 2016 Assembly election.

Inspected

Collector Archana Patnaik in the presence of political party representatives inspected the machines and ordered them to be kept safe at the office of the Deputy Director, Health Services, Race Course.

A press release from the district administration said that the machines arrived with police security in 12 vehicles from four districts in Bihar.

Four Bharat Electronics Limited engineers and 20 election wing officials would conduct preliminary inspection of the machines till February 19, the release added.
title: EVMs arrive in city
